boat.construction_details: Pitch pine planking on elm ribs, oak and elm centreline structure, oak stem and stern post, teak cabin top and comings.
boat.full_description:
Long keel double ended gaff sloop (21ft LOD / 20ft 7" LWL), with bowsprit and stern hung rudder. Approx 4 tonnes. Built in 1932 by William Kings and Sons of Burnham-On-Crouch as an enlargered version of Snipe, referred to by East Coast maritime author, Francis B Cooke.

With her current owners, Shearwater has cruised Welsh coasts extensively and undertaken extended trips to Brittany, Cornwall, Scilly Isles, Ireland, Isle of Man and Scotland (incl. Outer Hebrides and the Isle of Skye).
boat.name: Shearwater
